FTR_Cache_Armor.flavor: Even the finest weapon and the most violent attack halt before the mightiest armor.
FTR_Cache_Armor.name: Armor Cache

FTR_Cache_Elixir.flavor: One of the oldest forms of magic is the brewing of potions. By far the most common of these are healing potions, but more exotic Elixirs exist.
FTR_Cache_Elixir.name: Elixir Cache

FTR_Cache_Gem.flavor: Precious gems embody innate magical abilities. When set into a socketed item these gems can add powerful magic effects. Higher grades of gems have stronger effects.
FTR_Cache_Gem.name: Gem Cache

FTR_Cache_Gold.flavor: Gold has long served as the monetary means of trade in the world of Sanctuary. It is melted into small gold slugs that are flattened and stamped with the heraldry of the kingdom that created it.
FTR_Cache_Gold.name: Gold Cache

FTR_Cache_Jewelry.flavor: Before gold coins were accepted as the universal currency, the wealthy fashioned gemstones and precious metals into jewelry. Court mages discovered these adornments could be enchanted magically.
FTR_Cache_Jewelry.name: Jewelry Cache

FTR_Cache_Materials.flavor: Adventurers that want to survive need to adapt. Creating value out of scraps is key to that.
FTR_Cache_Materials.name: Material Cache

FTR_Cache_Scroll.flavor: Over the centuries, many magical scrolls have been created which provide the reader with impossible abilities.
FTR_Cache_Scroll.name: Scroll Cache

FTR_Cache_Weapon.flavor: Weapons of all types, from the humble club to the magical staff have been lost throughout the violent history of Sanctuary. Pray they serve you better than their previous owners.
FTR_Cache_Weapon.name: Weapon Cache

GamblingCurrency_Key.flavor: Fragmented whispers of long forgotten secrets.
GamblingCurrency_Key.name: Whispering Key

Gloves_Rare_QST_Scos_Astaroth_02.flavor: Seared through the flames of combat long ago during the Days of Ash, these gauntlets were forged in the demonic fires of Astaroth and quenched in the blood of heroes.
Gloves_Rare_QST_Scos_Astaroth_02.name: Charred Gauntlets

Helm_QST_Hawe_Delta_Zurke_03_Reward.flavor: A battered helmet marked with a glyph of the Tree of Whispers. The inside of this helmet reeks of embalming fluid as if it is meant to preserve the head of one who dies within it.
Helm_QST_Hawe_Delta_Zurke_03_Reward.name: Helm of Embalming

Helm_Rare_QST_Frac_KorValar2_01.flavor:
"When she placed the diadem upon her brow there came an overwhelming agony. It is written that through this, our Reverend Mother was cleansed of wickedness."
- Excerpt From The Trials of Prava
Helm_Rare_QST_Frac_KorValar2_01.name: Sunburst Diadem

Incense_III_00.flavor: This is a type III incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_III_00.name: Chorus of War

Incense_III_01.flavor: This is a type III incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_III_01.name: The Creatures of Night

Incense_II_00.flavor: This is a type II incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_II_00.name: Reddamine Buzz

Incense_II_01.flavor: This is a type II incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_II_01.name: Soothing Spices

Incense_II_02.flavor: This is a type II incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_II_02.name: Spiral Morning

Incense_II_03.flavor: This is a type II incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_II_03.name: Scents of the Desert Afternoon

Incense_I_00.flavor: This is a type I incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_I_00.name: Storm of the Wilds

Incense_I_01.flavor: This is a type I incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_I_01.name: Desert Escape

Incense_I_02.flavor: This is a type I incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_I_02.name: Song of the Mountain

Incense_I_03.flavor: This is a type I incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_I_03.name: Spirit Dance

Incense_I_04.flavor: This is a type I incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_I_04.name: Ancient Times

Incense_I_05.flavor: This is a type I incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_I_05.name: Sage's Whisper

Incense_I_06.flavor: This is a type I incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_I_06.name: Queen's Supreme

Incense_I_07.flavor: This is a type I incense. Only one Incense of a type may be active at a time.
Incense_I_07.name: Blessed Guide

LE_RewardCache_Large.flavor: Reward for completing an event and its optional objective
LE_RewardCache_Large.name: Large Event Reward Cache

Lorebook_Item_DS1.flavor: A guard petitions her captain to join the fight to save their capital city.
Lorebook_Item_DS1.name: Formal Request

Lorebook_Item_FP1.flavor: Our work in the old ruins is done. We have reached into Hell itself and grasped power, just as Mother showed us. We will offer tribute in thanks. Tonight and ever after, we will honor her.
Lorebook_Item_FP1.name: Vani's Journal

Lorebook_Item_FP2.flavor: Short fangs. Young. Freshly turned. An easy kill. Further south than the others. They are spreading.
Lorebook_Item_FP2.name: Specimen Notes

Lorebook_Item_Guulrahn_Prison.flavor: A Guulrahni villager's journal recounting the recent cannibal invasion.
Lorebook_Item_Guulrahn_Prison.name: Dropped Journal

Lorebook_Item_H9.flavor: A water stained collection of loose papers.
Lorebook_Item_H9.name: Villager's Journal

Lorebook_Item_KJ_Camp_Omaths.flavor: A Kehjistani message detailing plans for a revolution
Lorebook_Item_KJ_Camp_Omaths.name: Crumbling Leaflet

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_01.flavor: Lo, the Great Beast Tathamet was struck down and its blackened husk sank below the abyss. There, it smoldered and festered, and from the ruin of its Seven Heads were born Seven Great Evils. Three Primes and Four Lessers. Enemies of all creation.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_01.name: The Birth of Hell

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_03.flavor: To Monk Miatin. Please ensure this memo gets out to all monks of the Monastery. All tomes related to demon summoning, the old culture's blood magic rituals, and any recent reports of the increase in demon sightings should be brought to the inner cloister for storage.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiJournal_03.name: (A note from the Abbot of Orbei to another Monk.

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote.flavor: I suppose it is ironic that for so many decades we've been kept safe by our relative seclusion from the rest of Sanctuary. Now it will be our downfall. I can hear my fellow monks screaming beyond the doors.  Monk Miatin is rallying those of us that are left; we cannot allow the knowledge to leave. What else can I do? I will fight.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote.name: Blood-Soaked Handwritten Missive

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote2.flavor: Commissioned during the Time of Troubles, the Orbei Archive once served to codify heresies for the Inquisition. Since then, the Archive has expanded to the study of all evils, restricted to only the most devout Scholars of Zakarum.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote2.name: The Orbei Monastery, Part 1

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote3.flavor: Critics rightly fear the dangers of our scholarship, but ignorance of evil offers little protection from it. Our insights have proven invaluable to Paladins, Horadrim, and Angels alike in the fight against the darkness.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote3.name: The Orbei Monastery, Part 2

Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote4b.flavor: (PH) "Something isn't right, the Abbot has allowed the stranger into the Inner Cloister. He told him the words of our founders! I heard him! Take this note to Monk Lahya and..." The note ends with a scrawl and bloodstains.
Lorebook_Item_OrbeiNote4b.name: A small piece of scribbled parchment

Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_01.flavor: A weighty tome written by Lorath, documenting the Horadrim's struggles in recent decades.
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_01.name: Chronicles of the New Horadrim, Part One

Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_02.flavor: A weighty tome written by Lorath, documenting the Horadrim's struggles in recent decades.
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_02.name: Chronicles of the New Horadrim, Part Two

Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_03.flavor: A weighty tome written by Lorath, documenting the Horadrim's struggles in recent decades.
Lorebook_Item_QST_Conv_Vault_03.name: Chronicles of the New Horadrim, Part Three

Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_01.flavor: A tome written by Elias, describing the teachings and wisdom of Lilith.
Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_01.name: Gospel of the Mother

Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_02.flavor: A tome written by Elias, describing the teachings and wisdom of Lilith.
Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_02.name: Gospel of the Mother

Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_03.flavor: A tome written by Elias, describing the teachings and wisdom of Lilith.
Lorebook_Item_QST_EliasPalace_Elias_03.name: Gospel of the Mother

Lorebook_Item_QaraYisu_01.flavor: The cannibals took twelve more of us this week, but Elder Davan has finally gone to the mines. He will free the Ancient Spirit and we will claim its power. No one will threaten Qara Yisu again.
Lorebook_Item_QaraYisu_01.name: Watchman's Log

Lorebook_Item_ZakFortKeep_Paladin_Lord.flavor: I will become maggot food if I don't-
Lorebook_Item_ZakFortKeep_Paladin_Lord.name: Old book

Lorebook_Item_ZakFortKeep_Paladin_Lord_E.flavor: A squire of Paladin Marshal Carthas recounts their tribulations in Hawezar.
Lorebook_Item_ZakFortKeep_Paladin_Lord_E.name: Paladin Squire's Journal, Part One

Lorebook_Item_ZakFortKeep_Paladin_Orders.flavor: A squire of Paladin Marshal Carthas recounts their tribulations in Hawezar.
Lorebook_Item_ZakFortKeep_Paladin_Orders.name: Paladin Squire's Journal, Part Two

OW_LostMap_Item.flavor: Next to the river, along the sea, a lonesome tree, stands guard for me.
OW_LostMap_Item.name: Treasure Note

Polearm_QST_Kehj_Penitent_04_Reward.flavor: Once a weapon of zealous fury, then one of righteous vengeance. Its former owner may walk the path of true redemption, but this polearm is stained with blood that will never wash off.
Polearm_QST_Kehj_Penitent_04_Reward.name: Edgar's Penance

QST_Class_Barb_Beast_Item.flavor: The beast's head, encrusted with fried gore, still gives off an unnatural aura.
QST_Class_Barb_Beast_Item.name: Head of the Beast

QST_Class_Barb_Reward_Helm.flavor: The beast's bleached skull has accumulated an impressive collection of gouges and dents, both in life and afterwards.
QST_Class_Barb_Reward_Helm.name: Bone Helm of the Beast

QST_Class_Necro_Bone.flavor: A bone from a fallen enemy, mostly intact. This looks worthy of crafting into the body of a Golem.
QST_Class_Necro_Bone.name: Unbroken Bone

QST_Class_Sorc_Item_Codex.flavor: This mouldering volume is filled with cramped lines of spidery handwriting and drawings of obscure mystic symbols.
QST_Class_Sorc_Item_Codex.name: The Forgotten Codex

QST_Class_Sorc_Item_Paper.flavor: A random page of the Forgotten Codex, scribbled with cramped lines of obscure runes.
QST_Class_Sorc_Item_Paper.name: Codex Page

QST_Class_Sorc_Page.flavor: Scribbled with cramped lines of obscure runes.
QST_Class_Sorc_Page.name: Codex Page

QST_Class_Sorc_Reward_Focus.flavor: "A loosely bundled collection of ancient pages, covered with obscure runes. The sheaf of papers has an odd, organic feel when grasped, as though alive in some way."
QST_Class_Sorc_Reward_Focus.name: Forgotten Codex

QST_Conv_Donan_Letter.flavor: This letter between two Horadrim is written is a script that you cannot decipher.
QST_Conv_Donan_Letter.name: A Letter from Lorath to Donan

QST_Convergence_Act_Amulet.flavor: The Star beguiles. The threads of fate converge, but its story is not done.
QST_Convergence_Act_Amulet.name: The Nexus Star

QST_DryS_KedBardu_FetchMinor_01.flavor: A bag of non-perishable foodstuff and other stolen supplies. Still smells faintly of merchant's blood.
QST_DryS_KedBardu_FetchMinor_01.name: Stolen Supplies

QST_Dyee_DeliverItem1.flavor: A unremarkable amulet. You question why Dave cares about this.
QST_Dyee_DeliverItem1.name: Dave's Necklace

QST_Frac_BearTribeMedallion.flavor: A chain of small coins etched with various images of bears. Often worn by barbarians of the Bear Tribe.
QST_Frac_BearTribeMedallion.name: Warrior's Chain

QST_Frac_BeastChal_Goat_Heart_Quest.flavor: The head of Kauller is heavy for its size and appears fixed in a sightless snarl.
QST_Frac_BeastChal_Goat_Heart_Quest.name: Head of Kauller

QST_Frac_Cathedral_Vigo_FaithMedallion.flavor: This medallion is given to outsiders as a token of good faith. Iosef said it will grant access to Kor Valar.
QST_Frac_Cathedral_Vigo_FaithMedallion.name: Knights Penitent Medallion of the Faithful

QST_Frac_CutthroatsEscape_Key.flavor: The old mining tunnels were the perfect way to move goods--or people--through the mountains without attracting unwanted attention.
QST_Frac_CutthroatsEscape_Key.name: Smuggler's Key

QST_Frac_DeadMill_GhoulHeart.flavor: The pulsing of this horrid heart secretes an oily mucus.
QST_Frac_DeadMill_GhoulHeart.name: Ghoul Heart

QST_Frac_DeadPilgrim_Journal.flavor: Looking forward to my studies at the Cathedral. I hope I'll find peace there. Perhaps Priest Malone back in Margrave will see me as an equal now? Doubtful, but I should at least earn his respect...
QST_Frac_DeadPilgrim_Journal.name: Pilgrim's Journal

QST_Frac_DepthsOfDespair_Chalice.flavor: An ornate chalice of precious metal bearing the mark of the Cathedral of Light. There is a strange patina coating the inside of the bowl.
QST_Frac_DepthsOfDespair_Chalice.name: Holy Chalice

QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_BloodyChalice.flavor: An ornate chalice of precious metal bearing the mark of the Cathedral of Light. The inside of the bowl is coated with blood.
QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_BloodyChalice.name: Blood-Filled Chalice

QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_FinishedChalice.flavor: An ornate chalice of precious metal bearing the mark of the Cathedral of Light. There is a strange patina coating the inside of the bowl.
QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_FinishedChalice.name: Holy Chalice

QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_MundaneChalice.flavor: An ornate chalice of precious metal bearing the mark of the Cathedral of Light. It is well-polished and appears to have never been used.
QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_MundaneChalice.name: Silver Chalice

QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_OctaviaLetter.flavor: A hastily-written note from Sister Octavia. It describes her worsening health and suspicions that the demon you encountered in the sewers was not destroyed, but instead took her as its next host.
QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_OctaviaLetter.name: Sister Octavia's Letter

QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_PrayerBook.flavor: A well-loved book of litanies, prayers and psalms. Certain words are underlined, perhaps due to a deeply personal significance to those passages.
QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_PrayerBook.name: Sister Octavia's Prayer Book

QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_Reward.flavor: A well-loved book of litanies, prayers and psalms. Certain words are underlined, perhaps due to a deeply personal significance to those passages. The soft leather cover is strangely cold to the touch.
QST_Frac_FaithInBlood_Reward.name: Sister Octavia's Prayer Book

QST_Frac_ForgiveMe_Note.flavor: Roza, it pains me to say this - our lives together… they can be no longer. Something has befallen me. I fear I am now damned. Please, never come looking for me. I will love you forever. Your Julek.
QST_Frac_ForgiveMe_Note.name: Bloodied Note

QST_Frac_GaleValley_RareHarvest_Ore.flavor: A rare, gem-laden geode. A local jeweler may have the tools to open it.
QST_Frac_GaleValley_RareHarvest_Ore.name: Icebound Geode

QST_Frac_GaleValley_RareHarvest_OreKit.flavor: A cloudy vial filled with acid flux. This will help with opening one rare Fractured Peaks geode.
QST_Frac_GaleValley_RareHarvest_OreKit.name: Acid Flux

QST_Frac_GoldSpent_GemCache_Loot.flavor: Precious gems embody innate magical abilities. When set into a socketed item these gems can add powerful magic effects. Higher grades of gems have stronger effects.
QST_Frac_GoldSpent_GemCache_Loot.name: Merchant's Gem Cache

QST_Frac_GoldSpent_Gems.flavor: This large bag bears the mark of Merchant Meros and is heavy with a various gems inside.
QST_Frac_GoldSpent_Gems.name: Payment of Gemstones

QST_Frac_HamGriz_BarbHammer_Reward.flavor: This fabled hammer is considered sacred to the barbarians of the Bear Tribe.
QST_Frac_HamGriz_BarbHammer_Reward.name: Grizzly's Maul

QST_Frac_HamGriz_Hammer_Quest.flavor: The fabled hammer is considered sacred to the barbarians of the Bear Tribe.
QST_Frac_HamGriz_Hammer_Quest.name: Grizzly's Maul

QST_Frac_HoradricBook.flavor: A worn and dusty book with a faded Horadric seal on the cover.
QST_Frac_HoradricBook.name: Lesser Verses and Incantations

QST_Frac_Inheritance2_Axe.flavor: The axe is still slick with blood that seems to soak through any cloth wrapping the blade.
QST_Frac_Inheritance2_Axe.name: The Woodsman's Axe

QST_Frac_Inheritance_Axe.flavor: The axe is still slick with blood that seems to soak through any cloth wrapping the blade.
QST_Frac_Inheritance_Axe.name: The Woodsman's Axe

QST_Frac_KhazraBone.flavor: Bones of Ice Clan khazra, splintered in combat. The young chieftain of the Bear Tribe barbarians, known for his fondness of crushing weapons, collects them with pride.
QST_Frac_KhazraBone.name: Ice Clan Bones

QST_Frac_MaladyOfTheSoul_Chalice.flavor: An ornate chalice of precious metal bearing the mark of the Cathedral of Light. There is a strange patina coating the inside of the bowl.
QST_Frac_MaladyOfTheSoul_Chalice.name: Holy Chalice

QST_Frac_MeneCoffers_Tithe.flavor: This ledger details a heavy tithing requirement due to the Cathedral of Light. There are several tabbed sections noting inconsistencies and incorrect figures.
QST_Frac_MeneCoffers_Tithe.name: Tithing Demands

QST_Frac_PaleKnightsKin_Journal_01.flavor: A journal entry detailing the Light's Watch archivist's impressions of Knight Soliana Coste. This confirms that Zalan's mother was indeed stationed here.
QST_Frac_PaleKnightsKin_Journal_01.name: Archivist's Journal I

QST_Frac_PaleKnightsKin_Journal_02.flavor: A journal entry detailing the Light's Watch archivist's concerns with an impending mission. It seems the faithful had no illusions about their fate.
QST_Frac_PaleKnightsKin_Journal_02.name: Archivist's Journal II

QST_Frac_PaleKnightsKin_Journal_03.flavor: A journal entry detailing the Light's Watch archivist's futile attempt at convincing Soliana to flee the Knights Penitent to be with her son. Soliana's conviction was strong. Her mind was made.
QST_Frac_PaleKnightsKin_Journal_03.name: Archivist's Journal III

QST_Frac_Prologue_ChapelKey.flavor: A small, well-worn key, smeared with its owner's blood.
QST_Frac_Prologue_ChapelKey.name: Chapel Key

QST_Frac_Prologue_LorathsAmulet.flavor: An old amulet of unique design. It shows wear from years of use, perhaps as a badge of office.
QST_Frac_Prologue_LorathsAmulet.name: Strange Amulet

QST_Frac_Prologue_LorathsPolearm.flavor: While clearly old, its ornate blade has been kept sharpened and polished as though it would be needed again at any moment.
QST_Frac_Prologue_LorathsPolearm.name: Lorath's Polearm

QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletAnger.flavor: An aromatic and well-polished piece of cedar wood inscribed with the word "Anger".
QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletAnger.name: Holy Cedar Tablet

QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletCowardice.flavor: An aromatic and well-polished piece of cedar wood inscribed with the word "Fear".
QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletCowardice.name: Holy Cedar Tablet

QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletJealousy.flavor: An aromatic and well-polished piece of cedar wood inscribed with the word "Greed".
QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletJealousy.name: Holy Cedar Tablet

QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletNothing.flavor: An aromatic and well-polished piece of cedar wood inscribed with nothing but scribbles.
QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletNothing.name: Holy Cedar Tablet

QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletPride.flavor: An aromatic and well-polished piece of cedar wood inscribed with the word "Pride".
QST_Frac_Prologue_TabletPride.name: Holy Cedar Tablet

QST_Frac_SangChap_Book.flavor: The cursed chalice has a caked rich crimson lining the cup bowl.
QST_Frac_SangChap_Book.name: The Red Chalice

QST_Frac_SightMad_Eyeball_Necklace.flavor: This necklace contains a pair of eyeballs hooked into the small chain. While still wet to the touch, the pupils can also be observed dilating as if alive.
QST_Frac_SightMad_Eyeball_Necklace.name: Necklace of Eyes

QST_Frac_TaigaE_DropGift_Zalan01.flavor: This old painting of Margrave's town square has seen better days.
QST_Frac_TaigaE_DropGift_Zalan01.name: Faded Old Painting

QST_Frac_TaigaE_DropGift_Zalan02.flavor: A traveling trader recorded their journeys and sales in this book.
QST_Frac_TaigaE_DropGift_Zalan02.name: Merchant's Ledger

QST_Frac_TaigaE_DropGift_Zalan03.flavor: A weathered carving of a knight missing several pieces.
QST_Frac_TaigaE_DropGift_Zalan03.name: Carved Wooden Knight

QST_Frac_TaigaW_Motes_Werewolves_CacheIn.flavor: "Vengeance is my legacy. Take the spirits of werewolves and I will open."
QST_Frac_TaigaW_Motes_Werewolves_CacheIn.name: Hungering Bone Cache

QST_Frac_TaigaW_Motes_Werewolves_CacheLo.flavor: Its thirst for vengeance slaked, the magic seal appears to have faded.
QST_Frac_TaigaW_Motes_Werewolves_CacheLo.name: Sated Bone Cache

QST_Frac_TaigaW_RareHarvest_Herbs_01.flavor: A stalk of small violet blooms gathered while harvesting other herbs.
QST_Frac_TaigaW_RareHarvest_Herbs_01.name: Frostbloom

QST_Frac_TundraN_Motes_Skeletons_CacheIn.flavor: A magically sealed box. An engraving reads: "Take the spirits of the restless dead and grant them peace in return."
QST_Frac_TundraN_Motes_Skeletons_CacheIn.name: Sealed Exorcist's Cache

QST_Frac_TundraN_Motes_Skeletons_CacheLo.flavor: Its mandate fulfilled, the box's magical seal has faded.
QST_Frac_TundraN_Motes_Skeletons_CacheLo.name: Unsealed Exorcist's Cache

QST_Frac_Vault_Spellbook.flavor: Bound in black leather, necromantic runes run along the spine of the grim tome.
QST_Frac_Vault_Spellbook.name: Death Harnessed: Theories of Rathma

QST_Frac_Woodsman_Axe.flavor: The axe is still slick with blood that seems to soak through any cloth wrapping the blade.
QST_Frac_Woodsman_Axe.name: The Woodsman's Axe

QST_Gcarlson_Liber_Sanguinis.flavor: This bizarre text appears to be the mad ravings of some long dead surgeon. They describe a ritual intended to rebalance a piece of land's humors by drawing fourth blood from the earth and sky.
QST_Gcarlson_Liber_Sanguinis.name: Liber Sanguinis

QST_Hawe_APriceToPay_Venom.flavor: An acrid and extremely potent venom.
QST_Hawe_APriceToPay_Venom.name: Spider Venom

QST_Hawe_Act_Helm.flavor: Worn by a king, a usurper, a thief? A macabre trophy. A gift from the tree.
QST_Hawe_Act_Helm.name: Crown of Whispers

QST_Hawe_Arc_Reward.flavor: Upon pledging their life to serving the Tree of Whispers, witches of the swamp are gifted a root or branch to signify their accord.
QST_Hawe_Arc_Reward.name: Staff of Whispers

QST_Hawe_AtAnyCost_Candles.flavor: A handful of musty smelling, half-melted candles.
QST_Hawe_AtAnyCost_Candles.name: Half-Melted Candles

QST_Hawe_AtAnyCost_CorpseHead.flavor: The rotting, severed head of an Acolyte of Rathma. It speaks in a low moaning voice.
QST_Hawe_AtAnyCost_CorpseHead.name: Acolyte's Head

QST_Hawe_BadBlood_Potion.flavor: A concoction of snakemen parts and blood magic. Ingesting it might turn one into a snakeman.
QST_Hawe_BadBlood_Potion.name: Gulyas' Potion

QST_Hawe_Bog_HeartsBurden_CorpseDrop.flavor: A worn dagger, spotted with rust and covered in blood.
QST_Hawe_Bog_HeartsBurden_CorpseDrop.name: Rusted Dagger

QST_Hawe_Bog_Kres_01_Plant.flavor: A bundle of puffball reeds, named for the tight bundles of cotton-like flowers.
QST_Hawe_Bog_Kres_01_Plant.name: Puffball Reed

QST_Hawe_Bog_Kres_02_TimueItem.flavor: A strange relic with unknown purpose. A small face is carved into a shard of bone, placed atop a gnarled root.
QST_Hawe_Bog_Kres_02_TimueItem.name: Stolen Idol

QST_Hawe_Bog_Kres_02_TimueSalve.flavor: Timue created this salve from marsh snake venom. She claimed it would allow Kres to "regain some of what he has lost."
QST_Hawe_Bog_Kres_02_TimueSalve.name: Timue's Salve

QST_Hawe_ByThree_Booze.flavor: A bottle of mead from Scosglen. This honey wine is combined with biteberry juice to provide a pleasing shade of crimson and a robust flavor.
QST_Hawe_ByThree_Booze.name: Cerrigar Red Sky

QST_Hawe_ByThree_PrayerBook.flavor: A well-loved collection of observations and thoughts. Several of the pages were lost, but you have restored them to where they belong.
QST_Hawe_ByThree_PrayerBook.name: Symon's Tattered Journal

QST_Hawe_Coast_BroughtToHeel_Item_01.flavor: A variety of wild red mushroom from Hawezar that causes nausea and vomiting.
QST_Hawe_Coast_BroughtToHeel_Item_01.name: Wild Red Mushrooms

QST_Hawe_Coast_BroughtToHeel_Item_02.flavor: A variety of wild red mushroom from Hawezar that causes nausea and vomiting.
QST_Hawe_Coast_BroughtToHeel_Item_02.name: Wild Red Mushrooms

QST_Hawe_Coast_BroughtToHeel_Item_03.flavor: A variety of wild red mushroom from Hawezar that causes nausea and vomiting.
QST_Hawe_Coast_BroughtToHeel_Item_03.name: Wild Red Mushrooms

QST_Hawe_Coast_DropGift_Lyndon01.flavor: An expensive bottle of ale with a distinctive maker's mark, imported from Kingsport. Lyndon might be interested in this.
QST_Hawe_Coast_DropGift_Lyndon01.name: Kingsport Ale

QST_Hawe_Coast_DropGift_Lyndon02.flavor: The swamp has crept into every crevice of this intricate crossbow. "Rea" is carved onto the handle.
QST_Hawe_Coast_DropGift_Lyndon02.name: Forgotten Crossbow

QST_Hawe_Coast_DropGift_Lyndon03.flavor: A plain iron medallion with the Thieves Guild symbol embossed into the center. Lyndon might be interested in this.
QST_Hawe_Coast_DropGift_Lyndon03.name: Thieves Guild Emblem

QST_Hawe_Coast_Lyndon_01_Item_Supplies.flavor: A small crate filled with dried leaves. A sharp, pungent scent surrounds the crate, stinging your nostrils.
QST_Hawe_Coast_Lyndon_01_Item_Supplies.name: Lyndon's Supplies

QST_Hawe_Coast_PoisonedHearts_AmuletRewa.flavor: This simple necklace is emblazoned with the symbol of the Zakarum. However it has been scorched by flame to the point of being barely recognizable.
QST_Hawe_Coast_PoisonedHearts_AmuletRewa.name: Aneta's Keepsake

QST_Hawe_Crossway_RareHarvest_Ore.flavor: This is a rare, gem-laden geode. A local silversmith sells the necessary tools crack this open into several gems.
QST_Hawe_Crossway_RareHarvest_Ore.name: Gem-laden Geode

QST_Hawe_Crossway_RareHarvest_OreKit.flavor: A cloudy vial filled with acid flux.
QST_Hawe_Crossway_RareHarvest_OreKit.name: Acid Flux

QST_Hawe_DarkPath_LockboxKey.flavor: A small worn key. It looks like it fits a chest or lockbox.
QST_Hawe_DarkPath_LockboxKey.name: Lockbox Key

QST_Hawe_DeadintheWater_Salvage.flavor: Various resources salvaged from the Forsaken Coast. They smell of rotting flesh.
QST_Hawe_DeadintheWater_Salvage.name: Salvaged Resources

QST_Hawe_Delta_EliasFinger.flavor: The preserved small finger from Elias' left hand. It emits a dark aura that sets you on edge.
QST_Hawe_Delta_EliasFinger.name: Elias' Mummified Finger

QST_Hawe_Delta_Zurke_01_Corpse.flavor: This graverobber's corpse lacks warmth and has not yet been infected by flies. Despite the body's stiffening, it manages to fit in your bag.
QST_Hawe_Delta_Zurke_01_Corpse.name: Samil's Corpse

QST_Hawe_Delta_Zurke_02_Flesh.flavor: This sample of flesh was collected from one of Zurke's experiments. It displays normal symptoms of decay.
QST_Hawe_Delta_Zurke_02_Flesh.name: Uncorrupted Flesh

QST_Hawe_Delta_Zurke_03_Fungus.flavor: This parasitic fungus is native to the Hawezar marshland and requires blood supply to sustain itself. While the fungus cap is safe to handle, inhaled spores root themselves into the lungs.
QST_Hawe_Delta_Zurke_03_Fungus.name: Blood Fungus

QST_Hawe_Fens_Motes_Snakes_CacheInert.flavor: Sealed by necromancy. Its lock hungers for the essence of death.
QST_Hawe_Fens_Motes_Snakes_CacheInert.name: Hungering Necrolyte's Cache

QST_Hawe_Fens_Motes_Snakes_CacheLoot.flavor: Its thirst for death slaked, the magic seal appears to have faded.
QST_Hawe_Fens_Motes_Snakes_CacheLoot.name: Sated Necrolyte's Cache

QST_Hawe_GreaterGood_Supplies.flavor: Bundles of food and clothes. Nothing looks overly valuable.
QST_Hawe_GreaterGood_Supplies.name: Backwater's Missing Supplies

QST_Hawe_Kres_02_Ingredient.flavor: A dark, thin fluid. An oily sheen catches the light.
QST_Hawe_Kres_02_Ingredient.name: Marsh Snake Venom

QST_Hawe_Kres_03_DismemberedRemains.flavor: A burlap sack filled with human remains, dried and shriveled. The lack of blood and viscera has created a desiccated, leathery corpse.
QST_Hawe_Kres_03_DismemberedRemains.name: Exsanguinated Remains

QST_Hawe_M09_InvPage01.flavor: A section of a larger tome, it is largely illegible due to smears of blood and ashes.
QST_Hawe_M09_InvPage01.name: Inquisitor's Ledger, Chapter 1

QST_Hawe_M09_InvPage02.flavor: A section of a larger tome, it is largely illegible due to smears of blood and ashes.
QST_Hawe_M09_InvPage02.name: Inquisitor's Ledger, Chapter 2

QST_Hawe_M09_InvPage03.flavor: A section of a larger tome, it is largely illegible due to smears of blood and ashes.
QST_Hawe_M09_InvPage03.name: Inquisitor's Ledger, Chapter 3

QST_Hawe_M09_InvPage04.flavor: A section of a larger tome, it is largely illegible due to smears of blood and ashes.
QST_Hawe_M09_InvPage04.name: Inquisitor's Ledger, Chapter 4

QST_Hawe_Marsh_DropGift_Timue01.flavor: A small clipping of an unusual red briar that is found only in Hawezar.
QST_Hawe_Marsh_DropGift_Timue01.name: Budding Crimson Thorn

QST_Hawe_Marsh_DropGift_Timue02.flavor: An incredibly worn and dirty doll that resembles Timue. There is a mushroom growing out of her eye.
QST_Hawe_Marsh_DropGift_Timue02.name: Timeworn Timue Doll

QST_Hawe_Marsh_DropGift_Timue03.flavor: Something is strange about this venom, as compared to the venom of other Nangari. It has no color.
QST_Hawe_Marsh_DropGift_Timue03.name: Curious Venom

QST_Hawe_Marsh_Incense.flavor: A bundle of dried incense. The strong, earthy scent clings to the back of your throat and makes your head swim.
QST_Hawe_Marsh_Incense.name: Mystic Incense

QST_Hawe_Marsh_TempleLeftEye.flavor: A palm-sized red gemstone removed from the engraved stone door in Yngovani. It glows with a fiery light.
QST_Hawe_Marsh_TempleLeftEye.name: Serpent's Left Eye

QST_Hawe_Marsh_TempleRightEye.flavor: A palm-sized yellow gemstone removed from the engraved stone door in Yngovani. It glows with a sickly light.
QST_Hawe_Marsh_TempleRightEye.name: Serpent's Right Eye

QST_Hawe_NecroticResearch_Bones.flavor: A pile of flesh and bone fragments from a Nangari necromancer's minion.
QST_Hawe_NecroticResearch_Bones.name: Necrotic Flesh

QST_Hawe_NecroticResearch_Venom.flavor: A bottle of Nangari venom carefully extracted from dead snakemen.
QST_Hawe_NecroticResearch_Venom.name: Snake Venom

QST_Hawe_PoisonedHearts_AnetasNecklace.flavor: This simple necklace is emblazoned with the symbol of the Zakarum. It bears significant scorch marks.
QST_Hawe_PoisonedHearts_AnetasNecklace.name: Aneta's Keepsake

QST_Hawe_S04_Clue01_InvLetter.flavor: Written hastily and with many scribbled out sections, this shabby old note is hard to read.
QST_Hawe_S04_Clue01_InvLetter.name: Kaan's Note

QST_Hawe_S04_Clue02_InvMusicBox.flavor: A set of hand-engraved windchime sails made with obvious care but modest skill.
QST_Hawe_S04_Clue02_InvMusicBox.name: Windchime Sails

QST_Hawe_S04_Clue03_InvMusicCylinder.flavor: This bag contains a bunch of hand-carved windchime strikers.
QST_Hawe_S04_Clue03_InvMusicCylinder.name: Windchime Strikers

QST_Hawe_S05_AldaraJournal.flavor: Aldara's journal is mostly a tally of names and payments.
QST_Hawe_S05_AldaraJournal.name: Aldara's Journal

QST_Hawe_S05_BrechtJournal.flavor: A scorched journal found on a corpse.
QST_Hawe_S05_BrechtJournal.name: Brecht's Journal

QST_Hawe_S05_ItemAmulet.flavor: This amulet looks oddly discolored and feels almost feverish to the touch.
QST_Hawe_S05_ItemAmulet.name: Aldara's Amulet

QST_Hawe_Soulrot_Eyeballs.flavor: The plucked eyeballs are wet as thick mucus coats the parts newly exposed.
QST_Hawe_Soulrot_Eyeballs.name: Oversized Snake Eyes

QST_Hawe_Soulrot_Fungus.flavor: The fungus glows a strange green and offers a pungent odor long after being harvested.
QST_Hawe_Soulrot_Fungus.name: Gano Fungus

QST_Hawe_Soulrot_Head.flavor: The severed head of a reported werewolf has reverted to that of a human. Only the scent of decay is present, as the flesh is largely intact.
QST_Hawe_Soulrot_Head.name: Grotesque Head

QST_Hawe_Soulrot_Medicine.flavor: Medicine brewed with Gano Fungus. It has an earthy smell.
QST_Hawe_Soulrot_Medicine.name: Gano Fungus Medicine

QST_Hawe_Soulrot_MoldHeart.flavor: The mold-covered heart slowly pulses, sending a small puff into the air.
QST_Hawe_Soulrot_MoldHeart.name: Moldy Heart

QST_Hawe_SwampsProtection_Package.flavor: A bag of medicine and food Timue made to ease the suffering of the infected.
QST_Hawe_SwampsProtection_Package.name: Timue's Supplies

QST_Hawe_Taissa_QuestReward.flavor:
"Healing is a journey. A series of steps. Some days you may stumble, but so long as you continue to put one foot in front of the other, you will reach your destination."
- Recently carved inscription
QST_Hawe_Taissa_QuestReward.name: Mark of the Conclave

QST_Hawe_TheHeretic_Flower01.flavor: The petals of this flower are blackened as if left too near a great heat.
QST_Hawe_TheHeretic_Flower01.name: Singed Daisy

QST_Hawe_TheHeretic_Flower02.flavor: The stem droops under the weight of the sickly flowers. This plant would not have lasted long even before you picked it.
QST_Hawe_TheHeretic_Flower02.name: Withered Delphinium

QST_Hawe_TheHeretic_Flower03.flavor: The petals fall from the flower the moment you touch it.
QST_Hawe_TheHeretic_Flower03.name: Dying Rose

QST_Hawe_Verge3_Spell_Material.flavor: The vial glows with a penetrating light.
QST_Hawe_Verge3_Spell_Material.name: Vial of Purified Quicksilver

QST_Hawe_Verge5_Lotus.flavor: The Yellow Lotus leaves are covered in a sticky clear film.
QST_Hawe_Verge5_Lotus.name: Yellow Lotus

QST_Hawe_Verge5_Maggot_Ichor.flavor: A foul corrosive ichor that can cause skin to itch and wither over a short time.
QST_Hawe_Verge5_Maggot_Ichor.name: Maggot Queen Ichor

QST_Hawe_Verge_Motes_Fallen_CacheInert.flavor: A mysterious repository with an engraved chain that resists all conventional means of opening. The chain shows Fallen being slain, and their lingering essence banished.
QST_Hawe_Verge_Motes_Fallen_CacheInert.name: Chained Zakarum Repository

QST_Hawe_Verge_Motes_Fallen_CacheLoot.flavor: A mysterious repository with chains that no longer bind it closed.
QST_Hawe_Verge_Motes_Fallen_CacheLoot.name: Unchained Zakarum Repository

QST_Hawe_Verge_Taissa_01_Item_RitualSupp.flavor: A collection of herbs for Taissa, to help with her pain.
QST_Hawe_Verge_Taissa_01_Item_RitualSupp.name: Medicinal Herbs

QST_Hawe_Verge_Taissa_02_Item_SkeletonKe.flavor: An ancient amulet fashioned from a raven's skull. Holding it conjures images of dark, forgotten places deep in the swamps. A fresh inscription has been crudely carved on its back side.
QST_Hawe_Verge_Taissa_02_Item_SkeletonKe.name: Mark of the Conclave

QST_Hawe_Verge_Taissa_02_SnakeBones.flavor: Even after being separated from its host, the magical eye of the Nangari Oracle continues to silently watch you.
QST_Hawe_Verge_Taissa_02_SnakeBones.name: Oracle Eye

QST_Hawe_Vyeresz_FetchMinor_02_Trinkets.flavor: The charms lining the amulet represent the prophet Akarat's virtues. Each Crusader is granted one upon initiation into the order.
QST_Hawe_Vyeresz_FetchMinor_02_Trinkets.name: Zakarum Prayer Amulet

QST_Hawe_Wetlands_FailedCrusader_01_Joha.flavor: An expertly crafted suit of armor. It hums with divine energy.
QST_Hawe_Wetlands_FailedCrusader_01_Joha.name: Johanna's Armor

QST_Hawe_ZakFort_Carthas_CarthasNote.flavor: Written by Carthas, paladin of the Zakarum. His letters are bold and deliberate.
QST_Hawe_ZakFort_Carthas_CarthasNote.name: Unsent Letter

QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Mehphist.flavor: Collect the manifestation of Mephisto's hatred to aid Ksenia's ritual.
QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Mehphist.name: Mephisto's Corruption

QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Mehphist.flavor: The first to fall to Mephisto's corruption. Mathias' blade is still wet with the blood of his fellow paladins.
QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Mehphist.name: Mathias' Betrayal

QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Mehphist.flavor: Refusing to draw his blade against his fellow paladins, Eleazar's blade is still wet with his own blood.
QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Mehphist.name: Eleazar's Choice

QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Mehphist.flavor: Watching her fellow paladins turn against Carthas, Alodia's blade is still wet with the blood of those she slew in anger.
QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Mehphist.name: Alodia's Wrath

QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Motes_Me.flavor: Collect the manifestation of Mephisto's hatred to aid Ksenia's ritual.
QST_Hawe_ZakFort_SealedQuarters_Motes_Me.name: Mephisto's Corruption

QST_Hell_Act_Chest.flavor: Terror begets Hate and Hate begets Destruction, Destruction begets Terror..
QST_Hell_Act_Chest.name: Cuirass of the Prime Evils

QST_ITM_Scos_ClawsattheThroat_WornInsign.flavor: A tarnished emblem stained with ash. It displays a beast's visage, worn with age.
QST_ITM_Scos_ClawsattheThroat_WornInsign.name: Worn Insignia

QST_ITM_Step_AuguryofBones_BoneDust.flavor: Powdered remains from the ancient dead of the Valley of the Strayed.
QST_ITM_Step_AuguryofBones_BoneDust.name: Bone Dust

QST_ITM_Step_HubrisSmilesBack_JawOfferin.flavor: An ornamented jawbone offering. The sound of distant laughter seems to emanate from the bone itself.
QST_ITM_Step_HubrisSmilesBack_JawOfferin.name: Baneful Oblation

QST_Kehj_Armor_01_AlimArmor.flavor: The useful equipment, supplies, and effects of Alim, a fallen Iron Wolf. Three distinct puncture wounds tell of the soldier's final moments.
QST_Kehj_Armor_01_AlimArmor.name: Alim's Belongings

QST_Kehj_Armor_01_TalaArmor.flavor: The useful equipment, supplies, and effects of Tala, a fallen Iron Wolf. Fresh blood stains tell of the soldier's final moments.
QST_Kehj_Armor_01_TalaArmor.name: Tala's Belongings

QST_Kehj_Caldeum_DropGift_Barez01.flavor: A well-maintained sword taken as a trophy by a Triune cultist. Barez will want to see it.
QST_Kehj_Caldeum_DropGift_Barez01.name: Iron Wolf Sword

QST_Kehj_Caldeum_DropGift_Barez02.flavor: It is tradition among the Iron Wolves to reclaim the armor of their fallen so it may continue to serve. Barez will want to see this.
QST_Kehj_Caldeum_DropGift_Barez02.name: Iron Wolf Armor

QST_Kehj_FinalStraw_BagofOats.flavor: These fresh oats would be a tempting delicacy for a hungry camel.
QST_Kehj_FinalStraw_BagofOats.name: Bag of Oats

QST_Kehj_GeaKul_FetchMinor_06_Trinkets.flavor: These scent glands were harvested from the Khazra's abdomen. In this fresh state, they ooze a liquid that is noticeably pungent and musky.
QST_Kehj_GeaKul_FetchMinor_06_Trinkets.name: Khazra Glands

QST_Kehj_GeaKul_FetchMinor_07_Journal.flavor: A treasure goblin dropped this worn journal. Much of the scribbles are illegible, but there are some notes tracking the goblin's movements. A name is written on the inside cover: Ostaf.
QST_Kehj_GeaKul_FetchMinor_07_Journal.name: Old Journal

QST_Kehj_HighDesert_ZakFetch_ThiefNote.flavor: A note written in scratchy handwriting. A hastily drawn image, resembling the Zakarum artifact, is drawn in the corner.
QST_Kehj_HighDesert_ZakFetch_ThiefNote.name: Handwritten Note

QST_Kehj_HighDesert_ZakarumItem.name: Zakarum Relic - OLD DO NOT USE

QST_Kehj_HighDesert_ZakarumItem2.flavor: A Zakarum relic used for honoring the dead. Though grime, dust, and blood dull the once impressive craftsmanship, it still brings a feeling of comfort to the followers of the Zakarum faith.
QST_Kehj_HighDesert_ZakarumItem2.name: Zakarum Holy Relic

QST_Kehj_Infection_01_CurePlant.flavor: The small, fragile flower of a Kehjistan palm tree. Despite its beautiful colors, it has a pungent aroma like rotting flesh.
QST_Kehj_Infection_01_CurePlant.name: Ghost Palm Flower

QST_Kehj_Infection_01_CurePlant_CellarBo.flavor: The small, fragile flower of a Kehjistan palm tree. Despite its beautiful colors, it has a pungent aroma like rotting flesh.
QST_Kehj_Infection_01_CurePlant_CellarBo.name: Ghost Palm Flower

QST_Kehj_Item_PayDue_LockBox.flavor: A key-locked box, still heavy with coin. Judging by the tool marks, someone tried to pry it open.
QST_Kehj_Item_PayDue_LockBox.name: Miners' Lockbox

QST_Kehj_KIA_IronWolvesArmor.flavor: The armor set of a fallen Iron Wolf. Three distinct puncture wounds tell of the soldier's final moments.
QST_Kehj_KIA_IronWolvesArmor.name: Battered Iron Wolf Armor

QST_Kehj_LadyOasis_Conduit.flavor: This metal conduit surprisingly has no rust despite the ages of disuse.
QST_Kehj_LadyOasis_Conduit.name: Magical Conduit

QST_Kehj_LadyOasis_IzelGem.flavor: This glass vial that Izel possesses radiates warmth and pulsates faintly.
QST_Kehj_LadyOasis_IzelGem.name: Izel

QST_Kehj_LadyOasis_Stone.flavor: This glass vial fits in the palm of your hand. The glass is fogged and dull from age, but faint writing can still be seen. Its tongue is unknown to you.
QST_Kehj_LadyOasis_Stone.name: Vizjerei Vessel

QST_Kehj_LadyoftheOasis_Gem_Flippy.flavor: The Yellow Lotus leaves are covered in a sticky clear film.
QST_Kehj_LadyoftheOasis_Gem_Flippy.name: Yellow Lotus

QST_Kehj_LonelyWolf_02_BanditNote.flavor: A weathered stone affixed on a simple metal chain. An occultist symbol has been carefully carved onto the stone's surface.
QST_Kehj_LonelyWolf_02_BanditNote.name: Cultist Trinket

QST_Kehj_LowDesert_DropGift_Innkeeper01.flavor: A lost shipment originally destined for Baraim, the Gea Kul innkeeper.
QST_Kehj_LowDesert_DropGift_Innkeeper01.name: Battered Crate

QST_Kehj_LowDesert_Motes_Goatmen_CacheIn.flavor: Sealed by khazra magic. It hungers for sacrificial essence.
QST_Kehj_LowDesert_Motes_Goatmen_CacheIn.name: Sealed Khazra Offering

QST_Kehj_LowDesert_Motes_Goatmen_CacheLo.flavor: The secret compartment in this offering can be opened.
QST_Kehj_LowDesert_Motes_Goatmen_CacheLo.name: Glowing Khazra Offering

QST_Kehj_LowDesert_RareHarvest_Herb.flavor: An unusual mushroom picked while harvesting herbs in Kehjistan.
QST_Kehj_LowDesert_RareHarvest_Herb.name: Spotted Mushroom

QST_Kehj_Oasis_DropGift_Innkeeper02.flavor: A letter that has been handled carelessly, stained with salt and smeared ink. It is addressed to Baraim of Gea Kul.
QST_Kehj_Oasis_DropGift_Innkeeper02.name: Waterstained Letter

QST_Kehj_Oasis_FetchMinor_02_Seaweed.flavor: This alga flourishes in the warm waters of Kehjistan. This particular gutweed has been rotting inside Drowned intestines. The smell is nauseating.
QST_Kehj_Oasis_FetchMinor_02_Seaweed.name: Digested Gutweed

QST_Kehj_Oasis_GeaKulRefugees_Supplies.flavor: A quaint burlap sack filled with dense, coarse bread, dried meats, and ragged clothing.
QST_Kehj_Oasis_GeaKulRefugees_Supplies.name: Lost Supplies

QST_Kehj_Oasis_Note_GeaKulNote.flavor: PH:  Our spiders have caught threads of an escape by some of our debtors. Ensure they do not make it to Dahlgur. Bring us their faces so that we may show the cost of avoiding your debts.
QST_Kehj_Oasis_Note_GeaKulNote.name: Gea Kul Orders

QST_Kehj_Oasis_RareHarvest_Ore.flavor: An unexpected type of ore found while mining in Kehjistan.
QST_Kehj_Oasis_RareHarvest_Ore.name: Unusual Ore

QST_Kehj_Penitent_02_Item.flavor: A small, ornate trinket used by the Knights Penitent to identify informants and other civilian allies.
QST_Kehj_Penitent_02_Item.name: Inquisitor's Insignia

QST_Kehj_PinchofPoison_ScorpionGlands.flavor: Venom is injected through the massive stinger at the tip. These must be handled carefully.
QST_Kehj_PinchofPoison_ScorpionGlands.name: Scorpion Venom Glands

QST_Kehj_Remnants_Note.flavor: Knights have invaded the city and found the Zakarum records. They think the church members are heretics. We need to get out of here. I will be waiting by the bazaar. Be careful. Yours, Hader
QST_Kehj_Remnants_Note.name: Crumpled Note

QST_Kehj_Ridge_Motes_Cultists_CacheInert.flavor: Sealed by necromancy. Its lock hungers for the essence of death.
QST_Kehj_Ridge_Motes_Cultists_CacheInert.name: Ravenous Necrolyte's Cache

QST_Kehj_Ridge_Motes_Cultists_CacheLoot.flavor: Its thirst for death slaked, the magic seal appears to have faded.
QST_Kehj_Ridge_Motes_Cultists_CacheLoot.name: Sated Necrolyte's Cache

QST_Kehj_TracesofIron_HealingItem.flavor: The amulet bears decades of small nicks and scratches. It was well loved.
QST_Kehj_TracesofIron_HealingItem.name: Jilan's Family Heirloom

QST_Lorebook_ScosLegacies_Deed.flavor: This deed contains the details of the family lineage of the Garan line.
QST_Lorebook_ScosLegacies_Deed.name: Garan Deed

QST_Prologue_Act_Boots.flavor: Wearer be blessed. Keep steady feet and a true heart.
QST_Prologue_Act_Boots.name: Intrepid Reckoning

QST_Reward_Cache_Elixir.flavor: One of the oldest forms of magic is the brewing of potions. By far the most common of these are healing potions, but more exotic Elixirs exist.
QST_Reward_Cache_Elixir.name: Elixir Cache

QST_Reward_Cache_Gem.flavor: Precious gems embody innate magical abilities. When set into a socketed item these gems can add powerful magic effects. Higher grades of gems have stronger effects.
QST_Reward_Cache_Gem.name: Gem Cache

QST_Reward_Cache_Herbs.flavor: The people of Sanctuary use herbs as medicine, occult reagents, or simple decor through their daily lives. Much like gems, herbs embody fundamental properties of magic and this defines their use.
QST_Reward_Cache_Herbs.name: Herb Cache

QST_Reward_Cache_Leather.flavor: Used universally for almost all durable, flexible purposes, both in armor and tool production, fine quality leather enjoys a status as key commodity in Sanctuary.
QST_Reward_Cache_Leather.name: Leather Cache

QST_Reward_Cache_Obols.flavor: Eerie, ancient, possibly cursed: The murmuring obol is largely used in trade among collectors and occultists. So, naturally, an adventurer should carry plenty.
QST_Reward_Cache_Obols.name: Murmuring Cache

QST_Reward_Cache_Ore.flavor: Iron and silver are the two most commonly-used metals in Sanctuary; iron for durable hard-wear goods, and silver for embellishment, magical artifice, or general purity.
QST_Reward_Cache_Ore.name: Ore Cache

QST_Reward_Cache_Salvage.flavor: "Never let good garbage go to waste." - The Junk Dealer
QST_Reward_Cache_Salvage.name: Salvage Cache

QST_RogueInnerSight_Lorebook_BakiraNote.flavor: Leyrana. Got the coin, but it messed up my head. I saw worms digging in people's hearts. Their secrets, their scars. So easy to slice where the coin showed me... Had to stop it. I'm sorry.
QST_RogueInnerSight_Lorebook_BakiraNote.name: Hastily Written Note

QST_Scos_Blycroft_WardstoneCollection_it.flavor: Several stones carved with druid runes that hum with quiet power.
QST_Scos_Blycroft_WardstoneCollection_it.name: Druid Wardstones

QST_Scos_Braestaig_FetchMinor_07_Contrab.flavor: These wooden runes were carved by Merryn to aid in protection, health, and healing. Some meet such charms with suspicion and superstition, but these practices have existed since Vasily's time.
QST_Scos_Braestaig_FetchMinor_07_Contrab.name: Runic Charm

QST_Scos_BrinyFate_BenenLetter.flavor: A letter written to Fergus from Benen, telling him that he departed for distant shores to leave him behind. Benen speaks of the reality of their poor relationship.
QST_Scos_BrinyFate_BenenLetter.name: Rolled Letter

QST_Scos_Cerrigar_FetchMinor_01_Tusks.flavor: Carving designs into tusks such as these is an old pastime of the glenfolk.
QST_Scos_Cerrigar_FetchMinor_01_Tusks.name: Charger Tusk

QST_Scos_Coast_Motes_Drowned_CacheInert.flavor: An ancient vessel sealed with a strange seal, containing the belongings of someone who died long ago at sea.
QST_Scos_Coast_Motes_Drowned_CacheInert.name: Warded Sailor's Vessel

QST_Scos_Coast_Motes_Drowned_CacheLoot.flavor: Its thirst for death slaked, the magic seal appears to have faded.
QST_Scos_Coast_Motes_Drowned_CacheLoot.name: Sailor's Vessel

QST_Scos_Crone_Q1_BearHeart.flavor: An unnaturally large bear heart.  It gives off a strong smell of decay.
QST_Scos_Crone_Q1_BearHeart.name: Barret's Corrupted Heart

QST_Scos_Crone_Q2_RitualTome.flavor: A scroll on the containment of wild magic, transcribed by Yuein from the sacred stones beneath Túr Dúlra. The penmanship is exquisite, both on the runes and the notes for Shob'ha in the margins.
QST_Scos_Crone_Q2_RitualTome.name: Yuein's Transcription

QST_Scos_Downs_DropGift_Artair01.flavor: A broken carving of what looks like part of a large beast, specifically the clawed limbs.
QST_Scos_Downs_DropGift_Artair01.name: Broken Carving

QST_Scos_Downs_DropGift_Artair02.flavor: A broken druid totem that looks like part of a large beast, specifically the body.
QST_Scos_Downs_DropGift_Artair02.name: Broken Totem

QST_Scos_Downs_DropGift_Artair03.flavor: This carving of a bear's head is part of a larger totem used by druids when learning shapeshifting.
QST_Scos_Downs_DropGift_Artair03.name: Broken Bear Totem

QST_Scos_Druid_CQuest_Stag_Skull.flavor: This stag skull is covered in gore and feels unnaturally heavy.
QST_Scos_Druid_CQuest_Stag_Skull.name: Stag Skull

QST_Scos_Estate_Braega_Book_Item.flavor: A volume of the comprehensive history of Scosglen, authored by Braega.
QST_Scos_Estate_Braega_Book_Item.name: A History of Scosglen

QST_Scos_FeralMoon_MagicItem.flavor: "Wherever the Faithful walk, they bring the Light of Inarius to protect against the darkness."
QST_Scos_FeralMoon_MagicItem.name: Light-Blessed Amulet

QST_Scos_FieldsofRuin_GoatmanHead.flavor: Blackhorn and his Blood Clan marauders have preyed upon the farmers of Blycroft long enough.
QST_Scos_FieldsofRuin_GoatmanHead.name: Head of Blackhorn

QST_Scos_Highlands_FetchMinor_06_Horn.flavor: A massive, spiraling horn severed from a demon's skull. Even though the bone is mostly hollow, it feels heavier than a broadsword.
QST_Scos_Highlands_FetchMinor_06_Horn.name: Giant Demon Horn

QST_Scos_Hills_Motes_Wildlife_CacheInert.flavor: Warded by druidic rites, it waits for spirit energy to open.
QST_Scos_Hills_Motes_Wildlife_CacheInert.name: Ravenous Predator's Offering

QST_Scos_Hills_Motes_Wildlife_CacheLoot.flavor: The ward has been lifted with the culling of many strong beasts.
QST_Scos_Hills_Motes_Wildlife_CacheLoot.name: Appeased Predator's Offering

QST_Scos_Hills_Strand_Breadcrumb_Item.flavor: A burlap sack filled with loaves of bread, meats, cheese and other foods. Whoever filled this sack did so with love for its intended recipients.
QST_Scos_Hills_Strand_Breadcrumb_Item.name: Bag of Foodstuffs

QST_Scos_Item_DaughterOak.flavor: A clean cutting from the roots of the Great Oak. You can almost feel it move in your hand.
QST_Scos_Item_DaughterOak.name: Root Cutting

QST_Scos_OldWays_Artifact.flavor: A slightly damaged carved stone covered entirely with small runes. A great deal of knowledge is recorded here.
QST_Scos_OldWays_Artifact.name: Runic Tablet

QST_Scos_SignoftheTimes_GooseSign.flavor: A welcome sight to weary souls venturing through Scosglen, Under the Fat Goose Inn provides warmth when all else is extinguished.
QST_Scos_SignoftheTimes_GooseSign.name: Under the Fat Goose Inn Sign

QST_Scos_SignoftheTimes_ListofLastDeeds.flavor:
- Nick the sign from Under the Fat Goose
- Stare down the gateway statue of Maddux Watch
- Climb the old crane atop the waterfall in Old Heimberg
- Claim and cozy up in a Highland bear's den
QST_Scos_SignoftheTimes_ListofLastDeeds.name: Tavish's List of Last Deeds

QST_Scos_SignoftheTimes_TavishDaggers.flavor: Nairne used to play tavern games of courage with Tavish with these daggers. A piece of bloodstained cloth from Tavish's remains is tied around each of the hilts. A last memento to a departed friend.
QST_Scos_SignoftheTimes_TavishDaggers.name: Bloodstained Mementos

QST_Scos_TendingNature_Bark.flavor: Moss-covered bark from a mature woodwraith.
QST_Scos_TendingNature_Bark.name: Woodwraith Bark

QST_Scos_TendingNature_Essense.flavor: The distilled matter of a ghost, now twice dead.
QST_Scos_TendingNature_Essense.name: Spectral essence

QST_Scos_TendingNature_Herb.flavor: The gangly root of a bitterleaf plant often used in remedies.
QST_Scos_TendingNature_Herb.name: Bitterleaf Root

QST_Scos_TendingNature_Medicine.flavor: A mixture of rare ingredients combined into a potion.
QST_Scos_TendingNature_Medicine.name: Bear Medicine

QST_Scos_TheDiviner_RuneStone.flavor: A powerful druidic focus, able to draw out the natural magic of Scosglen and channel it where it is needed. This may be the only one that survived the Days of Ash.
QST_Scos_TheDiviner_RuneStone.name: Túr Dúlra Runestone

QST_Scos_Tirmair_FetchMinor_03_Meat.flavor: This fresh meat was collected from thorn beasts. It is a tough, lean meal but will help fend off starvation.
QST_Scos_Tirmair_FetchMinor_03_Meat.name: Thorn Beast Meat

QST_Scos_TravelingScholar_Statue.flavor: A small, stone statue carved in the likeness of some animal.
QST_Scos_TravelingScholar_Statue.name: Worn Carving

QST_Scos_UnholyBloodlines_GoatmanBlood.flavor: Fresh blood from a dead khazra. This must be the "blood of the enemy" Artair needs.
QST_Scos_UnholyBloodlines_GoatmanBlood.name: Vial of Khazra Blood

QST_Scos_UnholyBloodlines_Totem.flavor: "To become the wolf is to become the hunter, fierce and free. To return to mundanity thereafter is the real trial."
QST_Scos_UnholyBloodlines_Totem.name: Druid Totem

QST_Scos_UnholyBloodlines_WolfBlood.flavor: Blood from a cursed werewolf. It is a dark, sickly color. Hopefully this will serve as the "blood of the ally" Artair requested.
QST_Scos_UnholyBloodlines_WolfBlood.name: Vial of Werewolf Blood

QST_Scos_VotivePassing_HandmadeTorc.flavor: A well made torc bearing runes of the Old Ways.
QST_Scos_VotivePassing_HandmadeTorc.name: Handmade Torc

QST_Step_AbahruRift_MerchantLetter.flavor: Thank you for helping Cousin Genbar. Times are hard for his stone-carving, but he is too stubborn to move his family and too proud to take charity. Give him a deal and I will pay the difference.
QST_Step_AbahruRift_MerchantLetter.name: Merchant's Letter

QST_Step_Act_Pants.flavor: Resplendent regalia tainted with the power of the corrupt which permeates the very fibers of its fabric and thread. These serve as an integral part of the ceremonial dress of the Primus.
QST_Step_Act_Pants.name: Breeches of the Primus

QST_Step_BloodAndSweat_doll_item.flavor: A worn and well-loved doll.  The word 'Tuya' is carved into it.
QST_Step_BloodAndSweat_doll_item.name: Crude Doll

QST_Step_CentralCanyon_RareHarvest_Ore.flavor: A small, unusual piece of ore found while mining in the Dry Steppes.
QST_Step_CentralCanyon_RareHarvest_Ore.name: Strange Ore Sample

QST_Step_Central_Motes_Demons_CacheInert.flavor: Sealed and stamped with the Oxen Tribe emblem. An inscription reads: "Gerti forged the arms within for one who drinks the fury of foes."
QST_Step_Central_Motes_Demons_CacheInert.name: Sealed Oxen Tribe Cache

QST_Step_Central_Motes_Demons_CacheLoot.flavor: The seal has faded, leaving the cache safe to open.
QST_Step_Central_Motes_Demons_CacheLoot.name: Unsealed Oxen Tribe Cache

QST_Step_Coast_DropGift_PriestErol01.flavor: A well worn book of Zakarum prayers and hymns. Show this to a priest.
QST_Step_Coast_DropGift_PriestErol01.name: Old Zakarum Prayerbook

QST_Step_Coast_Motes_Undead_CacheInert.flavor: "The way opens to those who make amends for past wrongs."
QST_Step_Coast_Motes_Undead_CacheInert.name: Sealed Penitent's Cache

QST_Step_Coast_Motes_Undead_CacheLoot.flavor: The dead restored to their rest, the magic seal appears to have faded.
QST_Step_Coast_Motes_Undead_CacheLoot.name: Unsealed Penitent's Cache

QST_Step_DemonLedger_DebtBook.flavor: A leather-bound ledger that is singed on the edges. Each page is filled with debts, however most of the names are scorched and illegible. The most recent name reads: Andreea of Lakren's Overlook
QST_Step_DemonLedger_DebtBook.name: Scorched Debt Ledger

QST_Step_DemonLedger_DebtBook_A.flavor: A leather-bound ledger that is singed on the edges. Each page is filled with debts, however most of the names are scorched and illegible. The next readable entry reads: Lyruk of Ked Bardu
QST_Step_DemonLedger_DebtBook_A.name: Scorched Debt Ledger

QST_Step_FateRetreat_FetchMinor_07_Ring.flavor: This ring of unknown origin has a disabled enchantment. If it was imbued with enough energy, perhaps it could be restored.
QST_Step_FateRetreat_FetchMinor_07_Ring.name: Deactivated Ring

QST_Step_FateRetreat_FetchMinor_07_Ring_.flavor: This unknown ring's enchantment has been reactivated. Energy radiates from the gem and gives off faint heat.
QST_Step_FateRetreat_FetchMinor_07_Ring_.name: Activated Ring

QST_Step_ForgingTheMaul_Ore.flavor: A rare ore coveted by Oxen Tribe blacksmiths for its malleability and resilience.
QST_Step_ForgingTheMaul_Ore.name: Silver Quartz

QST_Step_Grassland_RareHarvest_Herb.flavor: A bright yellow flower found while harvesting herbs in the Dry Steppes.
QST_Step_Grassland_RareHarvest_Herb.name: Dust Daisy

QST_Step_Guulrahn02_Prison_Lorebook.flavor: A small journal stained with blood.
QST_Step_Guulrahn02_Prison_Lorebook.name: Battered Journal

QST_Step_HungerforaNewLife_Proof.flavor: "... but the hunger is growing like a fire inside me. Though all they offer us is human flesh, I fear soon this hunger will overtake me, and I will have no choice but to give in ..."
QST_Step_HungerforaNewLife_Proof.name: Oyuun's "Proof"

QST_Step_Jirandai_FetchMinor_06_SpiderHe.flavor: This spider "heart" is naught but a blood filled sack-like organ collected from the abdomen.
QST_Step_Jirandai_FetchMinor_06_SpiderHe.name: Spider Queen Heart

QST_Step_NameofLove_Cleaver.flavor: It remains oddly sharp, despite years of disuse.
QST_Step_NameofLove_Cleaver.name: Cleaver of Undying Love

QST_Step_Onyx_FetchMinor_02.flavor: Personal effects taken from undead. These include arm bands, talismans, holy symbols, rings and jewelry as well as a few written notes and other various trinkets.
QST_Step_Onyx_FetchMinor_02.name: Personal Effects

QST_Step_Orbei_EliasLetter.flavor: A tome written by Elias, describing the teachings and wisdom of Lilith.
QST_Step_Orbei_EliasLetter.name: Gospel of the Mother

QST_Step_Orbei_ScholarsJournal.flavor: I was so excited when I walked into the Sacristy that day. Finally, my turn to speak the words and enter the Archive. Now I'd give anything to forget what I've learned. I don't think I'll ever sleep again.
QST_Step_Orbei_ScholarsJournal.name: Scholar's Journal

QST_Step_PoundofFlesh_GibbetKey.flavor: An old brass key, worn from years of use.
QST_Step_PoundofFlesh_GibbetKey.name: Gibbet Key

QST_Step_PoundofFlesh_Reward.flavor: The last holdout of the Onyx Watchtower, Borza the Grim inspired great fear and great respect among his crew. Even given a second chance at freedom, his underlings would always come crawling back.
QST_Step_PoundofFlesh_Reward.name: Borza's Bonecrusher

QST_Step_QaraYisu_FetchMinor_04_Bones.flavor: Artisans carve these bones into intricate beads for jewelry, clothing, hair, and décor. Khazra bones are thought to ward off curses and evil spirits. Whether true or not, it eases anxious souls.
QST_Step_QaraYisu_FetchMinor_04_Bones.name: Khazra Bones

QST_Step_SaltBegetsSalt_GoatBody.flavor: The lifeless body of Jargal's beloved goat, Tuji. The goat's eyes are glazed over, and its muzzle covered with salt
QST_Step_SaltBegetsSalt_GoatBody.name: Tuji's Body

QST_Step_SentimentalValue_Heirloom.flavor: Some of the gold-like finish has chipped away to reveal a dull surface underneath.
QST_Step_SentimentalValue_Heirloom.name: Ulagan's Uncle's Ring

QST_Step_Sooth_DropGift_Gesur02.flavor: A pouch filled with worn old coins from a variety of different cities.
QST_Step_Sooth_DropGift_Gesur02.name: Bag of Old Coins

QST_Step_South_DropGift_Gesur01.flavor: An old discolored silver amulet. This amulet's prayer of protection didn't help the traveler who owned it.
QST_Step_South_DropGift_Gesur01.name: Tarnished Amulet

QST_Step_WeightofSin_Bracelet01.flavor: A hand-carved bracelet tarnished by ash. Eagle wings span the underside of the bangle
QST_Step_WeightofSin_Bracelet01.name: Carved Bracelet

QST_Step_WeightofSin_Bracelet02.flavor: A hand-carved bracelet tarnished by ash. Eagle wings span the underside of the bangle
QST_Step_WeightofSin_Bracelet02.name: Carved Bracelet

QST_Step_WhatRemains_remains.flavor: The grisly remains of a cannibal victim.
QST_Step_WhatRemains_remains.name: Erdene's Remains

QST_Step_WorthyOfArreat_sword_item.flavor: A well made weapon fit for a warrior.  Despite its age, the weapon is sharp and free of rust.
QST_Step_WorthyOfArreat_sword_item.name: Ancient Crane Sword

QST_Steps_ForgingTheMaul_DemonHorn.flavor: Torn from a servant of the Burning Hells, this horn seethes with ill intent. Only a master of their craft could render this material into a weapon.
QST_Steps_ForgingTheMaul_DemonHorn.name: Oppressor Horn

QST_Steps_ForgingtheMaul_BrokenMaul.flavor: The Great Axe of Raekor, now scarred and damaged by the Triune's meddling.
QST_Steps_ForgingtheMaul_BrokenMaul.name: Broken Great Axe of Raekor

QST_Template_BranchingChoice.flavor: A scuffed and tarnished bronze loop
QST_Template_BranchingChoice.name: Worn Ring

QST_Template_BranchingChoice_Reward.flavor: A scuffed and tarnished bronze loop
QST_Template_BranchingChoice_Reward.name: Bede's Worn Ring

QST_Template_DGN_Side_Item_QuestChest.flavor: On the summoning and command of demonic felines.
QST_Template_DGN_Side_Item_QuestChest.name: Nekonomicon

QST_Template_DeliverItem.flavor: The ancient symbol of the Horadrim, made of hammered copper
QST_Template_DeliverItem.name: Horadric Amulet

QST_Template_DeliverItem2.flavor: A crude amulet. You question why anyone would want this.
QST_Template_DeliverItem2.name: Chotan's Necklace

QST_Template_DeliverItem3.flavor: "Thousands of years ago, before bags were invented, humanity carried everything around in their cupped hands." - Turkatron
QST_Template_DeliverItem3.name: Bag of Marbles

QST_Template_Motes_BasePop_Inert_Cache.flavor: Sealed by necromancy. Its lock hungers for the essence of death.
QST_Template_Motes_BasePop_Inert_Cache.name: Hungering Necrolyte's Cache

QST_Template_Motes_Reward_Cache.flavor: Its thirst for death slaked, the magic seal appears to have faded.
QST_Template_Motes_Reward_Cache.name: Sated Necrolyte's Cache

QST_Template_PlaceItemGridWorld_Crate.flavor: It's heavy and splintery. Ouch oof.
QST_Template_PlaceItemGridWorld_Crate.name: Wooden crate

QST_Volcano_FaithSoul.flavor: From the exterior, you'd never know who's soul this was or what their life was like.
QST_Volcano_FaithSoul.name: The Betrayer of Faith's Soul

QST_Volcano_TreacherousSoul.flavor: From the exterior, you'd never know who's soul this was or what their life was like.
QST_Volcano_TreacherousSoul.name: Tainted Soul

QST_ZakarumsPlight_Water.flavor: Bottle filled with water from the oasis for Zakarum Novitiate.
QST_ZakarumsPlight_Water.name: Water-filled bottle

Ring_Magic_QST_Frac_GaleValley_Main_05.name: Miner's Litany

Ring_QST_Kehj_LowDesert_LadyoftheOasis_0.flavor: A mage's ring for binding spirits. Etched along the outside are the true names of angels, demons and other mysterious entities, compelled to bestow power upon the ring's wielder.
Ring_QST_Kehj_LowDesert_LadyoftheOasis_0.name: Seal of the Vizjerei

Ring_QST_Step_FateRetreat_FetchMinor_07_.flavor: A foul yet ornate ring originally crafted to channel stygian magics. On closer inspection, it appears someone has recently inscribed the inside of the band with sigils of the Angiris Council.
Ring_QST_Step_FateRetreat_FetchMinor_07_.name: Demoniac's Boon

Ring_Rare_QST_Frac_GaleValley3_00.flavor: A small and unassuming signet ring. The inside, however, reveals a mixture of engraved astrological symbols as well as prayers to various deities and spirits. It also faintly smells of sulfur.
Ring_Rare_QST_Frac_GaleValley3_00.name: Vhenard's Esoteric Signet

Ring_Rare_QST_Frac_KorValar2_01.flavor:
"And last was bestowed upon our Reverend Mother a signet ring. With it, came the authority to rule over all who would submit to the Father."
- Excerpt From The Trials of Prava
Ring_Rare_QST_Frac_KorValar2_01.name: Signet of the Father

Ring_Rare_QST_Scos_Hills_05.flavor: Airidah's gift to Yorin; a druidic wardstone set into a ring inscribed with runes that bear the promise to keep the wearer safe. A gift from the past to safeguard the future.
Ring_Rare_QST_Scos_Hills_05.name: Sigil of Braestaig

Ring_Rare_QST_Scos_TheCrone.flavor: Made of twisted wood and containing traces of the Dark Thicket's twisted magic.
Ring_Rare_QST_Scos_TheCrone.name: The Crone's Blessing

Ring_Rare_QST_Scos_UnholyBloodlines_Una.flavor: A band of curious metal that belonged to Una given her by her lost love. The band, a rare alloy, gave her fortitude and served as the last lonely tether to her withering humanity.
Ring_Rare_QST_Scos_UnholyBloodlines_Una.name: Una's Lament

SMP_LuckyCoin.flavor: Hopefully it brings better luck for you than it did its previous owner
SMP_LuckyCoin.name: Lucky Coin

SMP_WishingWell_Ring.flavor: A seemingly ordinary ring, but wearing it fills you with dread
SMP_WishingWell_Ring.name: Ring of Misfortune

Staff_Rare_QST_Frac_GaleValley_Neyrelle_.flavor: A weathered yet expertly crafted staff of a Horadrim apprentice. Appears to have been used for martial training just as much as spellcasting. Engraved near the center is a rough letter "E".
Staff_Rare_QST_Frac_GaleValley_Neyrelle_.name: Horadric Initiate's Staff

Treasure_Dungeon_FracturedPeaks_01.flavor: A pair of rusty, notched iron cleats. Broken and warped.
Treasure_Dungeon_FracturedPeaks_01.name: Broken Climbing Cleats

Wedding_Ring.flavor: "To Reyna. My love for you is like this ring. It has no end. - Donnell"
Wedding_Ring.name: Reyna's Wedding Ring

World_SecretCellar_Key.flavor: Who knows what this could unlock?
World_SecretCellar_Key.name: Strange Key

World_SecretCellar_Relic_1.flavor: Though its purpose is lost to time, this was once an object of great significance.
World_SecretCellar_Relic_1.name: Bloody Wooden Shard

World_SecretCellar_Relic_2.flavor: Though its purpose is lost to time, this was once an object of great significance.
World_SecretCellar_Relic_2.name: Musty Tome

World_SecretCellar_Relic_3.flavor: Though its purpose is lost to time, this was once an object of great significance.
World_SecretCellar_Relic_3.name: Intricate Metallic Fragment

legendary_witch_ring_012_1.flavor: The scepter glows white hot, but a skilled wielder fears no pain.
legendary_witch_ring_012_1.name: Scepter of Scorched Flesh

Legendary_Generic_110.desc: Critical Strikes with Core Skills increase your Attack Speed by +{20/40}% for 3.0 seconds.
Legendary_Generic_110.name: Accelerating

Legendary_Generic_111.desc: You have +20.0% increased Crowd Control Duration and deal x{20/50}% increased damage to Unstoppable enemies.
Legendary_Generic_111.name: Exploiter's

legendary_generic_006.desc: Gain {10/20} of your Primary Resource for every 20.0% of your Life that you Heal.
legendary_generic_006.name: Starlight

legendary_generic_009.desc: Basic Skills grant 25.0% Damage Reduction for {4/8} seconds.
legendary_generic_009.name: of Might

legendary_generic_011.desc: Damaging an Elite enemy grants you a Barrier absorbing up to {375/750} damage for 10.0 seconds. This effect can only happen once every 30 seconds.
legendary_generic_011.name: of the Protector

legendary_generic_014.desc: Deal x{3/10}% increased damage for each second you stand still, up to x30.0%.
legendary_generic_014.name: of Inner Calm

legendary_generic_016.desc: Critical Strikes grant +{8/16}% Movement Speed for 1.0 second, up to 6 seconds.
legendary_generic_016.name: Wind Striker

legendary_generic_021.desc: Restore {1/4} of your Primary Resource when you Crowd Control an enemy.
legendary_generic_021.name: of the Umbral

legendary_generic_027.desc: Deal x{23/33}% increased damage while you have a Barrier active.
legendary_generic_027.name: Conceited

legendary_generic_034.desc: When hit while not Healthy, a magical bubble is summoned around you for {3/5} seconds. While standing in the bubble players are Immune. Can only occur once every 90.0 seconds.
legendary_generic_034.name: Protecting

legendary_generic_036.desc: You gain x{0.25/0.5}% increased Armor for 4.0 seconds when you deal any form of damage, stacking up to x{25/50}%.
legendary_generic_036.name: of Disobedience

legendary_generic_038.desc: Distant enemies have a 15.0% chance to be Stunned for 2.0 seconds when they hit you. You deal x{30/50}% increased damage to Stunned enemies.
legendary_generic_038.name: of Retribution

legendary_generic_063.desc: Skills deal up to x{24/34}% increased damage based on your available Primary Resource when cast, receiving the maximum benefit while you have full Primary Resource.
legendary_generic_063.name: Edgemaster's

legendary_generic_065.desc: You Heal for {2.5/10} Life per second for each Close enemy, up to 50 Life per second.
legendary_generic_065.name: of the Crowded Sage

legendary_generic_067.desc: Attacking enemies with a Basic Skill increases the damage of your next Core Skill cast by x{5/10}%, up to x50.0%.
legendary_generic_067.name: of the Expectant

legendary_generic_100.desc: While Unstoppable and for 2.0 seconds after, you gain +{10/25}% increased Movement Speed and can move freely through enemies.
legendary_generic_100.name: Ghostwalker

legendary_generic_102.desc: Lucky Hit: When you hit a Crowd Controlled enemy, there is up to a {30/50}% chance for that Crowd Control effect to spread to another unaffected enemy.
legendary_generic_102.name: of Shared Misery

legendary_generic_103.desc: Becoming Injured while Crowd Controlled grants you Unstoppable for 4.0 seconds. This effect has a {20/40} second Cooldown.
legendary_generic_103.name: Eluding

legendary_generic_104.desc: You have +8.0% increased Dodge Chance versus enemies affected by Damage Over Time effects. When you Dodge you gain {5/10} of your Primary Resource.
legendary_generic_104.name: Assimilation

legendary_generic_106.desc: Thorns damage dealt has a {20/40}% chance to deal damage to all enemies around you.
legendary_generic_106.name: Needleflare

legendary_generic_107.desc: While you have a Barrier active, there is a {20/30}% chance to ignore incoming direct damage from Distant enemies.
legendary_generic_107.name: of the Deflecting Barrier

legendary_generic_109.desc: You have x{12.5/25}% increased Critical Strike Chance against Injured enemies. While you are Healthy, you gain x{25/50}% increased Crowd Control Duration.
legendary_generic_109.name: Smiting

Loadscreen Tips.TIP001: Remember to spend your Skill Points when you level up to unlock new Skills and Passives or improve existing ones!
Loadscreen Tips.TIP003: Be sure to fill up your Healing Potion at the Healer {icon:Marker_Healer, 2.0} before leaving town.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP004: Salvaging your items will produce materials used for crafting, and can also unlock new looks in your Wardrobe {icon:Marker_Wardrobe, 2.0}
Loadscreen Tips.TIP005: Items lose durability and become less effective when you revive from death. You can repair your equipment at a Blacksmith {icon:Marker_Blacksmith, 2.0}
Loadscreen Tips.TIP006: You can revive other Players by clicking on their spirits. They can rejoin the fight immediately!
Loadscreen Tips.TIP007: Activate any waypoints {icon:Marker_Waypoint, 2.0} that you encounter on your travels to unlock a new fast travel location.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP008: When you grow powerful enough an Occultist {icon:Marker_Essence, 2.0} can extract and replace the powers on your Legendary items.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP009: Realm Rewards are shared with every character of yours on that realm. Open your map and check out the Renown panel to see what you can earn while exploring Sanctuary!
Loadscreen Tips.TIP010: The state of Sanctuary is based on the party leader's progress.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP011: Combat damage text is colored to mean different things: Critical Strike, Overpower, and Critical Hit combined with Overpower.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP012: You can increase the potency of your Healing Potions by visiting the Alchemist {icon:Marker_Crafter_Alchemist, 2.0}
Loadscreen Tips.TIP013: After finishing the Campaign, new challenges and rewards await in the Nightmare and Torment World Tiers!
Loadscreen Tips.TIP014: Elite enemies include Champions, Elites, Bosses, and Bloodmarked Players.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP015: Higher World Tiers grant you much more Experience from killing monsters.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP016: The Vulnerable status effect increases the damage taken by enemies for a short duration. It is represented by a purple glow around the Health Bar for enemies and a cracked Health Globe for you.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP017: The Knockdown status effect prevents enemies from moving or taking action for a short duration. It can be removed through Unstoppable or Immune effects.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP018: The Dazed status effect prevents enemies from attacking or using Skills for a short duration, but does not stop them from moving. It can be removed through Unstoppable or Immune effects.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP019: You are Fortified and take reduced damage as long as you have more Fortify than current Life. Certain Skills or item effects can grant Fortify, which cannot exceed your Maximum Life.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP020: The Tether status effect prevents enemies from walking out from inside of its radius. It can be removed through Unstoppable or Immune effects OR by destroying the target that you are tethered to.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP021: The Fear status effect prevents enemies from moving or taking action AND causes the affected target to run away for a short duration. It can be removed through Unstoppable or Immune effects.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP022: Joining a party will transfer you to the party leader's world, the state of which is determined by the leader's progress through the Campaign.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP023: Upon reaching Level 15 and completing the Legacy of the Magi quest, Sorcerers unlock Enchantments, allowing them to utilize powerful passive versions of their Skills.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP024: Enemies are considered affected by Rogue Traps when they are within a Trap's persistent area or afflicted with its harmful effects.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP025: Characters in Stealth cannot be directly targeted with attacks, however their Stealth will be broken if they are hit with incidental damage or if they use an attack.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP026: Rogues can use Imbuement Skills to modify some of their attacks to deal different types of Elemental damage and apply additional harmful effects.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP027: In each higher World Tier, monsters are more challenging. They run faster; their projectiles are more accurate and faster; their powerful attacks have reduced cooldown and are stronger; and Elite affixes are more powerful.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP028: Champion monsters that appear in World Tier 3: Nightmare and World Tier 4: Torment have damage resistance auras which do not protect themselves. Focus on killing them first.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP029: Powerful, build-changing Unique items can be found in World Tier 3: Nightmare and even more can be found in World Tier 4: Torment.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP030: Skills can trigger Lucky Hit effects. If a Skill has a Lucky Hit Chance of 50%, and an effect a 20% chance to Stun an enemy, then that Skill will Stun enemies on average 10% of the time.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP031: Overpowered attacks deal bonus damage to enemies based on the sum of your current Life and Fortified Life.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP032: Attacks have a 3% chance to Overpower.  This chance cannot be passively improved, but some effects can cause attacks to be guaranteed to Overpower.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP033: Necromancer Minions inherit 30% of most stats such as Critical Strike Chance and Attack Speed.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP034: Necromancers have various ways to drop Blood Orbs, which fall on the ground and heal them instantly when picked up.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP035: Necromancers have the ability to see and interact with Corpses.  Kill enemies to spawn their Corpse, and use that Corpse to raise Skeletons to fight for you!
Loadscreen Tips.TIP036: Necromancers can use the Book of the Dead to sacrifice the ability to summon their Minions for personal power.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP037: If all other Skeletons have been summoned, then Raise Skeleton will instead summon a Skeletal Priest who will temporarily buff all nearby Minions.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP038: Druids Shapeshift when they change into a different form, which can often grant them additional bonuses.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP039: Upon reaching Level 15 as a Druid, Druidic Spirit Offerings will begin dropping from enemies, which you can turn in at Túr Dúlra to increase your power.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP040: The Barbarian carries an entire Arsenal consisting of 4 weapons with them at all times. Which weapon you use for a Skill can be chosen while the Skill is assigned to your hotbar.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP041: Upon reaching Level 5 as a Barbarian, you will gain Expertise with the weapon type you are using.  This grants you bonuses for every attack using that weapon type.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP042: The more a Barbarian uses a particular weapon type, the more benefit they will gain from their Expertise.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP043: Upon reaching Level 15 as a Barbarian, you will be able to unlock your Technique slot.  You can gain the Expertise bonus of a certain weapon type regardless of which weapon type you use if you choose it as your Technique.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP044: Barbarians have various ways to become Berserk, which will give you increased damage and movement speed.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP045: The Barbarian's Arsenal consists of a Two-Handed Bludgeoning weapon, a Two-Handed Slashing weapon, and a Main Hand and Off-Hand pair.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP046: Players and enemies are Healthy when they are above 80% Life and Injured when they are below 35% Life.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP047: The first Capstone Dungeon becomes available in World Tier 2: Veteran after completing the Campaign.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP048: Lightning-based Sorcerers can generate and pick up Crackling Energy, which periodically damages enemies around them until all charges are depleted.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP049: Damage Over Time effects do not have random damage variance and cannot Critically Strike.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP050: Key Passives are the final unlock in the Skill Tree and provide powerful effects that can greatly enhance your build.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP051: Direct damage includes all damage dealt to enemies that is not from damage over time effects.
Loadscreen Tips.TIP052: Close enemies are those who are in Melee range.  Distant enemies are those who are outside of Melee range.
